job_description: Job description: Position Summary: Demonstrate a love for food and passion for people while creating an excellent customer experience by maintaining a friendly, safe and clean environment. Promote and deliver a shopping experience focused on providing customers with efficient service through hands-on knowledge of all department products. Demonstrate the company’s core values of respect, honesty, integrity, diversity, inclusion and safety.Essential Job Functions: · Demonstrate teamwork to ensure customer satisfaction and a pleasant working and shopping environment.· Provide friendly and efficient customer service by demonstrating sincerity, patience and respect in all customer interactions and by thanking customers for their business.· Greet customers in a genuine and friendly manner throughout the store and assist them by escorting them to products, loading/unloading heavy items and helping them to retrieve out of reach items.· Effectively communicate with customers and respond to questions and requests in a timely manner.· Operate equipment (e.g., box cutter, knives, slicers, wrappers, scales, processor, fryer, boaster, ovens, compactor, highboy cart, tongs, steamer, food processor, cleaning utensils, shrink wrappers, decorating tube, oven racks and hot cases) according to company guidelines.· Follow basic product handling procedures.· Assist with product production, packaging, presentation, rotation and replenishment· Ensure in-stock position of available product· Maintain working knowledge of all department equipment.· Gain and demonstrate a high level of operational execution, product skills and process skills.· Ensure consistent execution of all Department standard operating procedures (SOPs).· Utilize accomplished selling skills in order to secure additional sales and use suggestive selling techniques to increase sales of products during sales events.· Communicate code dating issues and shrink opportunities and monitor product quality to reduce shrink.· Create a product sales plan for each scheduled shift and identify department opportunities during scheduled shifts and create plans for improvement.· Plan work duties appropriately during the scheduled shift to accomplish all assigned tasks. Maintain high cleanliness standards; clean as you go, inclusive of washing, cleaning, sweeping, mopping.· Adhere to all local, state and federal laws, and company guidelines; comply with and reinforce all food safety and safety regulations/guidelines/procedures and programs; report all issues and illegal activity, including robbery, theft or fraud.· Assist general team members as needed.· Physical demands include, but are not limited to, walking on uneven ground, turning, standing, reaching stooping/bending, lifting/carrying objects 3 to 60 lbs., and pushing/pulling objects 500 to 1,500 lbs.; occasional lifting/carrying objects more than 60 lbs. and exposure to coolers and freezers· Must be able to perform the essential functions of this position with or without reasonable accommodation.We have a total benefits package including: · College tuition Reimbursement· 401k· Paid time off· Dental, Health and Vision insurance· College partnerships to earn discounted and free degrees (6 month waiting period applies)· Associate discount programs· Corporate partnership programs for discounted products including: Apple, Ford, Jeep, HP, and many more!· Well being assistant app-- offering free counseling, advice, and resources (childcare facilities, gyms, ect).· Associate assistance fund· Opportunities to grow in leadership and experience!Part time and Full time positions available. Positions vary based on hours.Overnights, mid day, morning and night shifts all available. Flexible availabilities offered.Job Types: Full-time, Part-timePay: $10.30 - $14.65 per hourWork Location: One location

job_description:
BASIC FUNCTION:This position assists with basic of Activities of Daily Living of the hospitalized patient with nursing direction.
IND123
QUALIFICATIONS:
Education: High school diploma or GED equivalent required. Courses in medical office administration and/or medical terminology preferred.
Experience: Requires three years of secretarial experience or office education degree may be substituted for experience.
Certificates, License, Registrations: None
Knowledge, Skills and Abilities: Must possess good verbal and written communication skills, customer service skills, basic computer knowledge, Microsoft office, and prior electronic health records system experience preferred.
Physical: Must possess good vision for use of computer and good hearing for answering the phone Sits, stands, and walks intermittently most of the work.
INTERPERSONAL RELATIONSHIPS:
Supervision Received: Clinic Manager
Supervision Exercised: None
Other: Patients, families, visitors, other hospital personnel, medical staff, other medical personnel, members of the general public
EXPOSURE TO HAZARDS:
Stress may be experienced due to situations that arise from disgruntled patients and physicians. According to OSHA standards, this position is classified as low risk with little or no exposure.
EQUIPMENT USED:
Computer, electronic healthcare management software, copy machine, fax machine, telephone, chart files, paper punch, credit card machine, staples, and pens/pencils.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
Sends medical reports per patient request according to HIPAA and clinic/hospital protocol.
Answers phone in professional and courteous manner. Creates patient cases and/or schedules patients as required.
Assists front desk with patient check-in and check-out as needed.
Monitors and ensures assigned queues in Athena are worked daily.
Daily deposit, cash drawer reconciliation and petty cash management.
Ensures cleanliness of waiting room.
Assists with patient care coordination calls.
Provides general administrative assistance to the Clinic Manager.
Other duties and tasks as assigned.
Continual surveillance and proactive participation in ongoing Infection Prevention and Control measures in accordance with policies located in the Infection Control Manual on MCN.

summary: Our CSM will help troubleshoot problems, provide guidance on best practices, and act as the customer voice internally, passing along feedback to product…
job_description: Customer Service Manger (CSM)American Signal Corporation a leading provider of Mass Notification Systems to Communities, the Education market, Military and industrial facilities is looking for a Customer Service Manager to create positive brand experiences for existing customers in order to support company expansion goals and reduce the possibility for churn and contraction. Our CSM will help troubleshoot problems, provide guidance on best practices, and act as the customer voice internally, passing along feedback to product development, engineering, and sales and marketing teams but most of make the Customers satisfaction priority one.Customer support responsibilities: Customer care — Our customer service manager’s main priority is to take care of customers and to provide them with the best possible experience. Whether in SaaS, where the CSM and our engineers and service technicians may be working with a specific customer repeatedly for an extended period of time, or a customer service rep who focuses on one-off inbound requests from consumers, the end goal is always to offer the maximum possible value, while demonstrating empathy and expertise.Technical support and problem solving — Providing technical support is core to the CSM roles. Our CSM will have to be knowledgeable enough to help brand new customers, while also working on the more complex issues that existing customers may have. They need to problem solve with empathy, in order to understand where customers are coming from and might be frustrated by.Account management — A customer success manager may also act as a de facto account manager as well, being the first to learn about intent to churn or return a product, and then working to provide incentives to help keep the customer.Help lead the support organization — Our Customer Service manager is the customer service team lead, they are expected to provide support to technicians, pay attention to overall team metrics, and synthesize customer issues and feedback for internal teams. They may also be expected to organize call center and technician schedules.Customer support metrics: Traditional metrics by which a CSM is judged can include:Net Promoter Score (NPS) — How likely a customer is to recommend a product to someone else.Customer satisfaction (CSAT) — How satisfied a customer is with the support interaction.Time to first response — How quickly a customer is engaged after submitting an issue.Handle time — How long it takes to resolve the issue.Ticket resolution rate — How many open tickets are resolved (in a set amount of time).Employee happiness and engagement — How happy team members are in their jobs and whether they are likely to leave (for people managers only)At American Signal Corporation we value our employees and believe that if we take care of the employees, they will take the best care of our customers which intern take care of the company.Job Type: Full-timePay: $25.00 - $30.00 per hourSchedule:Monday to FridayAbility to commute/relocate:Milwaukee, WI 53224: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Preferred)Education:High school or equivalent (Preferred)Experience:Customer Support & Client Services Occupations: 1 year (Preferred)Work Location: One location

job_description:
Equivalent Experience

A large tech company based in Redmond, WA is looking for an Executive Administrative Assistant to join their team.
Previous experience at a tech company preferred.
Job Description
Provides highly complex administrative support for an executive as well as business groups/global regions. Prioritizes own time, high-level managers time, and managers directs time. Makes administrative decisions and requests on behalf of high-level manager to provide complex calendar management. Proactively manages logistics for business group meetings/events. Uses diplomacy and professionalism to draft communications for high-level manager. Creates data management plans and manages data by using the advanced features of internal products/tools. Develops a deep knowledge of the overall business group strategy, and acts as an information resource to the business group. Anticipates and removes administrative roadblocks and makes timely decisions across the business group. Directly resolves customer requests and hosts business guests.
Skills & Qualifications
All qualifications of an Admin Assistant, plus 5-7 years executive support. No Degree or certification is required.
The ability to draft emails on behalf of high-level managers intended for high level managers.
Must be very organized, with a strong ability to multi-task as well as be a strong communicator
Prior experience at a large tech company is a big plus

Why This Role Is Interesting:
Competitive market comparison – 339 similar jobs within the Seattle, WA area.
The team has been working together for the last 15 years. Started out as interns and converted to FTE.
The team is big on work life balance.
Will have the opportunity to learn internal tools, be a part of a close team, and have the opportunity to convert / extend

Typical Day in the Role:
Filter emails, take care of any action items, calendar items, make any updates to the calendar, assist with onboarding, if this contractor ramps up in the first month may help with small projects, for example help create and edit templates for surveys, there will be some work for inputting people for space / place them in a spot for when thing begin to open.
PST, within business hours, typically 8am to 5pm PST, the team is flexible if they can get in contact with you within business hours. Currently remote but eventually will be expected to work on site 50% of the time.
Chance for extension later if they do well.

Expert Level

summary: This is a high-touch role and you must excel in developing relationships and delivering impeccable communication via email and phone.
job_description:
Property Manager - Chattanooga, TN
Annual Salary: $50,000 - $80,000

Evernest takes pride in our team members having a complete team-player mentality and this is 100% certain for our Property Manager position. We are looking for an accommodating and selfless person that can handle the variety and changes that occur in our environment each and every day.
Think of this position as a "client concierge" or an account manager as you'll be proactively interacting and serving our clients on a daily basis. This is a high-touch role and you must excel in developing relationships and delivering impeccable communication via email and phone. You'll also be working with our sales team daily to ensure our property owners are getting exactly what they need and expect.
In regards to communication, you must move with a natural sense of urgency (Very Important!), be upbeat, and do what you say you're going to do 100% of the time.
Every team needs someone who understands the reason behind handling the "small things." Some people excel in the details and others don't - and that's ok! You must be great with details, strive towards near perfection, AND seek out knowledge in all areas of your job.
If this summarizes you, let's talk. If you struggle taking direction, building strong relationships with people, moving with urgency, and having confidence in delivering perfect work - this will not be a good fit for you!

Keywords: Property Management, Real Estate

job_description:
HUMAN RESOURCES COORDINATOR POSITION

Power Personnel is a leading Bay Area health care staffing agency that embraces diversity and inclusion in all aspects of our business. Our Company was founded 25 years ago and continues today as a woman and minority-owned business. In this role, you will be embarking on a challenging opportunity with Power Personnel that will provide professional growth and development. With our roots firmly planted in the San Francisco Bay Area healthcare market, we continually grow our staffing services for Bay Area healthcare providers.



The Human Resources Coordinator position for Power Personnel, Inc. manages several tasks at once, demonstrates advanced communication and organizational skills while maintaining a warm, welcoming, and professional attitude. This is a full-time, non-exempt, fully remote position supporting all HR administrative functions for the Company. The position reports to the CEO.

Principal Duties:

Coordinate onboarding and offboarding for all employees.

Conduct new hire orientation, including partnering with tech support to ensure equipment is set up and login information is available on the first day of employment.

Act as HR point of contact for internal employees.

Assist with the development of policies and documentation of HR procedures and reports, as needed. Ensure updated policies are communicated to employees and labor law posters are posted and current.

Oversee, maintain, and coordinate employee files and HRIS functions. This includes training, coordination, and communication of changes and updates with payroll.

Update and maintain HR documentation electronic library.

Maintain annual performance evaluation schedule.

Process internal employment changes: change of status, rate changes, transfers, and promotions.

Assist accounting department with timesheet issues and data entry. Act as the primary point of contact for employee questions relating to payroll.

Coordinate requests for time off forms and processes.

Assist outside HR services team with employee relations issues.

Coordinate benefit enrollment activities: assist with yearly rollout of benefits open enrollment, process enrollment forms, and update HRIS as appropriate. Maintain company health/benefit plans library. Reconcile monthly insurance invoices. Point of contact for employee benefits questions. Work with broker/vendors as appropriate.

Work with outside HR services team to coordinate worker’ s compensation claims and yearly OSHA recording/reporting activities.

Assist with quarterly and annual audits to ensure the Company remains compliant with federal and state regulations concerning employment: EEOC, FLSA, OSHA, HIPPA, required labor law postings, I-9, and ACA requirements.

Performs other related duties as required and assigned.

Education and Experience:

Associate Degree in human resources or related field is required; or four years of experience of Human Resources experience in benefits, recruiting, and knowledge of the principals and practices of Human Resources management.

Minimum 2 years of experience with benefits coordination and open enrollment activities, preferred.




Required Qualifications:

The ability to manage competing priorities in a fast-paced environment while remaining calm, positive, and professional at all times.

Ability to effectively work with employees at all levels of the Company in a remote work environment.

Must exhibit excellent attention to detail, good judgment, prioritization skills, and identify and resolve problems in a timely manner.

Ability to maintain the confidentiality of sensitive and private data.

Demonstrated knowledge of and proficiency with MS Office programs to include Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook.

Excellent written and verbal communication skills.

Must have the ability to work independently with self-discipline and self-motivation.

Physical Requirements / Working Conditions:

Prolonged periods of sitting at a desk and working on a computer.

Remote work location.

Must be able to lift up to 15 pounds at times.




We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer committed to creating a diverse workplace and inclusive culture. Power Personnel makes hiring decisions based solely on qualifications, merit, and business needs at the time. We recruit, employ, terminate, train, compensate and promote without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identification, marital status, disability, genetic information, pregnancy, veteran status, or any other basis protected by applicable federal, state, or local law. Those applicants requiring assistance with the application and/or interview process should contact the Human Resources Department.

job_title: General Office Worker / General Clerk I
summary: Experience operating basic office equipment, (e.g., photocopier, facsimile, multi-line phone/voicemail systems, mailing machines, and minimal computer programs)…
job_description:
Focused on delivering unsurpassed services in support of law enforcement and homeland security, FSA, a rapidly growing joint venture owned by trusted solutions providers SAIC and AMENTUM, has a vacancy for a General Office Worker / General Clerk I (GC1). In this role, you will be supporting the overall mission of the U.S. Citizenship and Immigration Services (USCIS) and the operation of one of their Field Offices. These Field Offices process and adjudicate certain immigration applications and petitions.

A General Office Worker follows clearly detailed procedures in performing simple repetitive tasks in the same sequence.

As a General Office Worker your responsibilities will include:
Assisting applicants by providing requested forms and directing applicant flow.
Answering phones and direct calls to the appropriate person(s).
Providing support to applicants utilizing electronic systems.
Scheduling and or rescheduling dates and times of interviews and naturalization ceremonies.
Performing tasks related to preparing for and conducting naturalization ceremonies, including distribution of naturalization certificates and the retrieval of documentation from applicants.
Providing support for the processing of forms and applications used in the adjudication process.
Appropriately accomplishing tasks.
Completing related tasks as assigned.

A General Office Worker / General Clerk I (GC1) must meet the following qualifications:

High School Diploma or equivalent.
6 months to 1 year of limited general experience in a related discipline or field.
Additional educational achievements may be substituted for years of experience.

A General Office Worker must have the following knowledge, skills, and abilities:

Experience coding and filing documents.
Experience operating basic office equipment, (e.g., photocopier, facsimile, multi-line phone/voicemail systems, mailing machines, and minimal computer programs).
Ability to achieve acceptable quality levels in a fast-paced high-volume environment.
Ability to work effectively and efficiently in a team environment and relate well to others.
Ability to communicate clearly and effectively with coworkers both in written and verbal communications.
Ability to maintain a high level of confidentiality with sensitive information.
Strong commitment to performing and producing at the highest level of quality at all times.
Positive attitude focused on customer satisfaction.
Physical Requirements:
Read rapidly from both paper and a computer terminal.
There is a physical requirement to lift 45 lbs. or more consistently.
Mobility is frequent throughout the file room by moving on foot to accomplish tasks, particularly for moving files to and from the work site. The shelving of files also creates the need to be able to lift boxes overhead
Security Requirements:
Ability to pass a pre-employment background investigation, including a credit check and drug test.
Ability to obtain and maintain Office of Security and Investigations (OSI) background check/security clearance - full-field background check required for personnel accessing Interagency Border Inspection System (IBIS), Treasury Enforcement Communications System (TECS), Deportable Alien Control System (DACS).

FSA is proud to be an Affirmative Action/ Equal Opportunity Employer. We recruit, employ, train, compensate, and promote qualified persons in all job titles without regard to age, ancestry, color, gender, HIV status, marital status, medical condition, national origin, physical or mental disability, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation (including gender expression and identity) veteran status, family leave status, and any protected group status as defined by applicable law. FSA is proud to maintain a drug-free workplace. Satisfactory completion of a post-offer drug screening is a condition of employment. As a supplier of services to federal government agencies, such as DEA, FBI, USCIS, USPIS, etc., we also adhere to agency standards with respect to prior drug usage. COVID Policy: FSA adheres to contractual, governmental, and locality specific guidelines and mandates with respect to COVID-19. job_description:
Our client, a fast-growing tech start up firm, located in Flatiron, is seeking an Executive Assistant/Office Manager who will support 2 Co-Founders of the firm and run their office operations. The ideal candidate will be polished, energetic, and engaging with a nothing is beneath me attitude. Serving as the face of the firm, the successful candidate will establish a smart, friendly, and hospitable tone for all guests and employees alike. The ideal candidate will be collaborative, flexible, and an excellent multi-tasker. This is an amazing opportunity for a candidate to take ownership of a role and be a jack/jane of all trades for this boutique firm. Candidate must have at least two years of corporate experience and a positive, humble attitude. Ideally the candidate will be out the tech start-up space supporting a senior level executive.

Responsibilities:
Lead office logistics including storage organization, stocking supplies, and designing our hospitality and office maintenance program.
Schedule all meetings and manage time for two Co-Founders, using judgment to ensure they are maximizing their productivity.
General administrative duties such as expense reporting, preparing written communications, document filing in Dropbox (paperless office), document signatures, and shipping.
Book regular domestic and global travel arrangements for business and personal trips.
Liaise with the firm’s business partners while ensuring key relationships are maintained with excellence.
Plan firm events (presentations, dinners, offsites) end-to-end.
Manage all office vendors, deliveries, catering, and invoice reconciliation.
Conduct lightweight research, prepare reports, and analyze data to get us ready for meetings.
Handle various lightweight errands for the Co-Founders on a regular basis.
Proactively offer and implement suggestions to continuously improve organizational effectiveness and firm culture.
Maintain strict confidentiality and discretion with all firm information.
Qualifications:
Self-starter. You take initiative and find creative solutions in a fast-paced environment.
Excellent judgment. You choose options and prioritize among conflicting needs.
Internet native. You use LinkedIn, Google Docs, and cloud software. You solve problems with technology.
Precise communicator. You write and speak with clarity and express yourself concisely.
Nothing falls through the cracks. You like to build checklists for everything.
You finish what you start, sweat the details, and don’t stop until it’s great.
Minimum of 2 years of corporate work experience.
Bachelor’s degree or higher
Salary:
$100-130K base salary (DOE) + equity + 100% health, dental and vision, 20 days of PTO, and 401(K).

Hours:
Full time position at our Flatiron office, 9am-6pm weekdays
Flexibility for occasional after-hours work (e.g. when we have events) and errands
Availability by email / text / phone after-hours and 24/7 when co-founders are traveling
Interview Process:
Interviews with both of the company's co-founders
In-person deep dive into experience with both co-founders
3+ references from your previous managers / executives that you supported. We will chat with them to understand your contributions.
#IND1

job_description:
At Trustmark, you’ll work collaboratively to transform lives and help people, communities and businesses thrive. Flourish in a culture of diversity and inclusion where appreciation, mutual respect and trust are constants, not just for our customers but for ourselves. At Trustmark, we have a commitment to welcoming people, no matter their background, identity or experience, to a workplace where they feel safe being their whole, authentic selves. A workplace made up of diverse, empowered individuals that allows ideas to thrive and enables us to bring the best to our colleagues, clients and communities.


Summary: In this position, you must have good working knowledge of a call center and demonstrated ability to answer calls for multiple lines of business, assume additional responsibilities and participate in projects (e.g. cross training which may include a specialty line, email responses, voice boxes etc.) as assigned.


Responsibilities Include:

Answer incoming customer calls regarding, eligibility, benefit inquiries, claims status and payment information and processing service requests as needed, from our insureds and providers.
Assist with telephonic applications for prospective customers.
Maintain privacy/confidentiality following HIPAA and Company guidelines, while maintaining complete and accurate claim files, call logs and other applicable records.
Work directly with sales agents, brokers, external vendors to obtain information regarding customer claim status/benefits/or resolve customer other concerns.
Make follow-up calls to revolve issues, questions, concerns or to confirm service required.
Assist with insurance claims, including investigating and helping to solve or escalate issues to appropriate staff. Notifies the supervisor proactively of potential service issues or problems.
Assist with updating of procedures, training and auditing of others on main functions. Assists with projects, i.e. new products, system enhancements.
Other duties as needed/assigned.


Qualifications Include:

Must be able to work a daily rotational 37.5 hour work week between the hours of 8:00 A.M. – 6:00 P.M. EST and have the flexibility to occasionally work different hours based on customer needs in the future.
Knowledge of medical/dental terminology preferred.
Excellent communication (written and oral)/phone etiquette skills.
Ability to multi-task, prioritize, and meet deadlines in a fast-pace environment.
Excellent customer service/interpersonal skills and team focus.
Strong research, problem solving and organizational skills.
Flexible and adaptive to change.
Ability to work in an environment that requires standards of production and quality.
Spanish/English Bilingual speaking candidates encouraged to apply.
Knowledge of HIPAA Privacy regulations a plus.


Come join Trustmark! Join a team that will not only utilize your current skills, but will enhance them as well. Trustmark benefits include medical/dental/life insurance, tuition reimbursement, competitive 401k plan, insurance education classes, health and wellness initiatives and more!


 All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, sex, age, or disability.

job_description:
JOB DESCRIPTION
Budtenders are responsible for customer experience which includes; helping customers, processing the transaction, cash handling, and stellar customer service. You must possess the ability to listen well and communicate effectively with various audiences. As a critical part of the business operation, the Budtender will have the most interaction with the store’s patrons. Must be outgoing, passionate, and very knowledgeable on the products and cannabis. Budtenders also assist the Management Team with the activities and operations of the store, while abiding by policies, procedures, and operational guidelines.
RESPONSIBILITIES
Continuous cannabis education including, but not limited to, knowledge of strains, terpenes, consumption methods, cannabis culture, medical implications, efficacy, effects/high, aroma/tastes/aesthetic, state and municipal regulations for medical and recreational cannabis
Stay apprised of any events, promotions and special and promote them with customers
Provides quality customer service and always demonstrates professionalism
Greets customers warmly when they enter
Promotes a work environment that is positive, customer-service oriented, and compliant with state and local laws and regulations established company policies and procedures.
Accurately record any pertinent notes that will help provide excellent customer service when the customer/patient returns
Attempt to obtain additional data for marketing purposes following the SOP (i.e. cellular phone number and email address)
Verifying proper ID for customers/patients
Accurately use and maintain the Point of Sale (POS) system including correct cash handling and discount application
Full responsibility for an accurate cash drawer and accurate cash transactions
Participate in inventory cycle counts accurately and in a timely manner
Ensure a presentable presence on the sales floor, including but not limited to clean and neat workstations and well maintained displays
Completes all assigned tasks during overlap hours
Make sales recommendations, cross-sell products and introduce new ones
Bag, box, or wrap purchase after appropriate items are labeled in accordance with state regulations
Complete Opening/Closing duties, initialing the checklist appropriately
Refers to “Time to lean, time to clean” cleaning list when there is down time on the sales floor
Other duties as assigned by the Manager and/or Store Lead
SKILLS/ABILITIES REQUIRED
Customer Service
Organization
Close Attention to Detail
Time Management Skills
Excellent Communication
Teamwork
Problem Solving Skills
REQUIREMENTS/PREFERRED EXPERIENCE
High school diploma or General Education Diploma (GED)
Must stay current and adhere to all policy and regulations of the Cannabis Compliance Board (CCB)
Must be 21 years of age
Must be able to obtain a State issued Cannabis agent card
Must not have been convicted of any felony offense
Ability to work within a closely supervised environment
A minimum of 1+ years of experience is preferred. Ideal candidates will have previous experience working in a cannabis retail setting or customer service-related industry
Works in a timely manner and strives to increase productivity
Knowledge and familiarity with Cannabis
Solid math skills, language, and reasoning skills.
Basic weights and measurement skills, ability to operate a digital scale
Experience in marijuana growing, cultivating, and trimming preferred
May be required to work nights and weekends
Demonstrated oral and written communication capabilities
Must be authorized to work in the United States
PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS
Able to use a computer for extended periods of time
Ability to stand on feet or sit for extended periods of time
Ability to have extended cannabis exposure, with no adverse physical reaction
Ability to use repetitive use of hands, wrists and forearms
Ability to see, hear, speak and write English clearly to communicate effectively with customers, employees and visitors
Fine visual acuity with the ability to adjust focus to inspect closely, ability to see color
Normal vision or corrected by use of glasses and/or contacts for normal reading and viewing abilities to determine the accuracy, neatness, and thoroughness of the work assigned, or to make general observations of facilities or structures
Requires eye-hand coordination and manual dexterity sufficient to meet job and operate equipment requirements
Requires normal range of hearing with the ability to perceive the nature of sounds at normal speaking levels with or without correction, and having the ability to receive detailed information through oral communication, and making fine discriminations in sound
Ability to twist, turn, bend, stand and walk as required to perform the duties associated with functioning as a dispensary manager
Pushing/pulling/carrying, with the ability to lift up to 50 pounds occasionally
Able to move about a typical office or retail environment
Able to perform general administrative activities
Able to lift and move up to 25 pounds occasionally
Regular and on-time attendance
Hours may exceed 40 hours per week.
Nothing in this job description restricts management’s right to assign or reassign duties and responsibilities to this job at any time.
WORK ENVIRONMENT:
Work is primary performed in a dispensary setting. The working area may be odorous at times and loud due to fans and filtration systems, fluctuating between cold and warm temperatures. Involves frequent contact with staff, vendors and customers. Work may include dealing with law enforcement and occasional State inspectors.

summary: Working with sales, marketing, operations, and business-to-business departments to ensure a smooth process and customer satisfaction.
job_description:
Title: Customer Care Associate (REMOTE) FT/PT
Reports To: Director of Customer Care / Customer Care Supervisor
Pay: Starting at $15/hour
Hours: 10am - 7pm M-F, 9am - 5pm Saturday (Closed Sundays, Thanksgiving Day, Christmas Day)
The Customer Care Associate is a remote inbound/outbound customer service call center role that is focused on creating strong communication pathways between SimpleTire and its customers. This role will require that someone have excellent customer service skills, familiarization in de escalation tactics, is highly organized and has exceptional attention to detail. As this is a customer-facing role, the Customer Care Associate is an extension of SimpleTire, and will need to conduct themselves with a polite, clear, and concise demeanor.
The Customer Care Associate is responsible for:
Handling inbound and outbound phone calls, emails, and chat from online customers. Verifying customer account information and order information. Managing on average 30-40 calls per day.
Processing online orders, returns, replacements, adjustments, warranties, and installations. Tracking deliveries, installation, inventory, pricing, and ensuring all customers’ needs are met.
Managing customer issues, ensuring 100% customer satisfaction, including (but not limited to) telephone and email follow-up. Understanding and resolving customer questions, concerns, issues, and needs. Maintaining positive relationships with customers post-order to gauge satisfaction, solicit feedback, and meet any additional needs.
Working with sales, marketing, operations, and business-to-business departments to ensure a smooth process and customer satisfaction.
Handling special projects or other duties as assigned.
The Ideal Candidate Has/Is:
Prior experience - 6 months to 2 years of prior experience in a call center environment - receiving inbound customer service calls and/or conducting outbound customer service calls.
Adaptable and Dependable - Ideally available to work full time during hours of operation (8am – 7pm M-F, 9am – 5pm Sat) including split shifts and evening hours. Ability to support holiday work hours of operation until 8pm. Adaptable and dependable.
Prior Education - High school diploma required, Associates/Bachelors degree preferred.
Highly communicative - able to clearly and concisely facilitate the flow of communication and to field questions and concerns in an organic and effervescent way. Excellent written and verbal composure.
Externally polished and focused - ability to represent SimpleTire’s commitment to providing incredible outbound relations to all within the SimpleTire network. Highly engaged and upbeat, with a customer first mentality.
Listening skills - ability to listen to a Tire Installers’ needs and concerns to help solve problems quickly and easily.
Organized and detailed - updating the documents and sheets consistent with the process flow. Desire to support our customers’ needs with excellent follow through and detail.
Calm and composed - Demonstrated ability to remain calm in escalated environments. Can effectively manage an ever-evolving work environment with a positive, upbeat attitude and outlook.
Mental Agility - ability to think quickly and shift priorities rapidly as necessary. Coachable and open to change. Demonstrated critical thinking skills, with the ability to multitask and work independently.
Digitally Savvy - Thorough understanding of computer systems and experience with Google and/or Microsoft office suite.
Bi-Lingual (not required) - Ability to fluently speak and write in Spanish is a bonus.
Prior interest in the retail/automotive industry (not required)
Physical Job Requirements
Continuous viewing from and inputting data to a computer screen.
Sitting for long periods of time.
Additional Schedule Details
Holiday Black Out Periods: November 24th thru December 31st
Agent Schedules: Vary based upon business needs; 40 hour work week schedules are preferred, 25 hour work week minimum
Benefits and Perks
Medical, dental, vision, STD, LTD, Company paid Life Insurance, 401k with Employer match, 15 days of Paid Time Off, and 8 paid holidays.
Company sponsored events, casual dress code, free snacks & SWAG, corporate discounts, and free parking (when applicable).
We are hiring for the following states:
Pennsylvania, New York, New Jersey, Ohio, Massachusetts, Connecticut, Florida, Arkansas, Utah, Indiana, and South Carolina.
SimpleTire is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, national origin, religion, sex, pregnancy, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, physical or mental disability, covered veteran status, or any other class protected by applicable law. EEO Employer M/F/NB/Vet/Disabled. SimpleTire will consider for employment qualified applicants with criminal histories in a manner consistent with all federal, state, and local laws
-
Our Story
SimpleTire is what you get when you pair two brothers who are passionate about tires with a tech junky who’s obsessed with efficiency.
Co-founded as the shared vision between brothers Andy and Josh Chalofsky, and their longtime friend Kenny Pratt, we are the answer to the overly complicated and daunting task of buying replacement tires, for everyone.
Our story began as an idea that emerged when Andy and Josh were working in their family’s brick and mortar tire business and realized the business could work well in an e-commerce environment. As the market began to shift towards new technologies, it was clear to them that e-commerce would be the next forefront for the tire industry and wanted to create a solution that would incorporate private businesses.
In 2012, our co-founders successfully converted the traditional business model into a technology-driven model, which linked independent tire distributors across the country into one seamless e-commerce network, creating SimpleTire.
Today, our network stretches across the country with 10,000+ installers and 3,000+ independent supply points. We employ hundreds of people, support thousands of local businesses, and strive to empower everyone along the process.
We employ 110+ people in our headquarters located in the greater Philadelphia area. We are proud of the culture we have created where every team member plays an integral role in the company’s success. In 2020 t e Company was named a “Best Places To Work” by Tire Business Magazine and was awarded “Top Workplace in the Delaware Valley by the Philadelphia Inquirer.
Company Overview
We think there’s a better way when it comes to getting work done on your car. Starting with tire replacement.
A way that’s more welcome. That’s more you. That gets you to what you need, more quickly. Helps you feel smart about your choices. And gets you on your way, feeling good. A way with lots of data, and tech, and smart thinking. From step one to step done. A way better experience for tire replacement. That's our way. That’s our promise.
Way simple. Way better.

summary:
A Concierge Experience Specialist who will deliver on a first-class experience to all current and future guests.
Ability to work evenings and weekends.
job_description:
Who we are...
AvantStay delivers exceptional, unique stays for group travelers. The company has built a tech-enabled millennial hospitality brand to be the new standard for group experience. We are venture funded and growing rapidly in the explosive $100+ billion dollar STR industry.
What we are looking for:
A Concierge Experience Specialist who will deliver on a first-class experience to all current and future guests. This person is a dynamic, passionate, service-oriented professional who is very organized and knows how to create amazing experiences for guests. This person will support guests from the moment they book their stay and is passionate about helping people and enhancing the guest experience in every way possible. We have streamlined the most consistent + tech-driven experience in the short-term rental market, and the Concierge Experience Specialist brings hospitality to the forefront of what we do.


What you’ll do…
Respond to guest inquiries promptly, personally, discreetly and with the goal of opening the conversation and ensuring they feel welcome.
Convert concierge service & experience requests into bookings and effectively manage lead opportunities and outreach efforts.
Support in market concierge teams in maintaining a consistent guest experience.
Keep relevant systems updated with customer information and property details.
Provide knowledgeable and correct information on AvantStay properties and policies.
Understand who our guests are, what brought them to AvantStay, their intent and timeline to book, thus creating a robust Customer Profile.
Establish relationships with key vendors in markets across the country and negotiate service agreements.
Attend weekly meetings and provide organized updates succinctly.
Build and maintain positive relationships with guests, field operators and local vendors.
Provide the highest level of customer support + concierge services to all current and future guests.
Maintain knowledge on Concierge and Value Added services in all markets.
Engage the guests, be sincere and genuine, anticipate and exceed guests’ expectations and own the experience.
Be a professional brand ambassador for our company when dealing with internal and external customers and vendors.
What you’ll bring…
2+ Years of Sales, Customer service and / or Concierge experience required
Background in hospitality, real estate and / or short-term rentals preferred
Background in Sales and Call Center environment preferred
Positive, enthusiastic and passionate about the home sharing economy
Ability to understand and convey business issues and technical concepts
Strong sense of team mentality and reliability
Capable of quickly learning new software systems
Strong written and verbal communication skills and attention to detail
Ability to work evenings and weekends
Legal right to work in the United States
Perks + Benefits…
Pay rate: $20-24/hr, DOE including commission
Benefits and PTO Policy
Team bonding and off-site events
Complimentary and discount stays at AvantStay properties
Fully remote role



When you join AvantStay… You’ll be doing work that matters alongside an experienced and dynamic team, transforming the way people travel and vacation. Your place within the colossal travel and real estate industries will leave you with a wealth of opportunities to feel both challenged to innovate and rewarded for your efforts. Of course, we will offer you pay and benefits, but we’re about more than that. AvantStay is a place where you can craft your own path to greatness. Whether you think in code, words, pictures or numbers, find your future at AvantStay.

Equal Employment Opportunity...We're proud to be an equal opportunity employer- and celebrate our employees' differences, including race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, and Veteran status. Different makes us better.
AvantStay, Inc. is a proud member of PledgeLA, an organization that believes that Los Angeles will become the most diverse and civically-engaged tech hub in the nation. Our members, tech companies and VC firms or accelerators based in Los Angeles, commit to increasing their level of community engagement and improving diversity, equity, and inclusion within their organization and investments.

summary: Every day.® by offering products that are frequently used and replenished, such as food, snacks, health and beauty aids, cleaning supplies, basic apparel,…
job_description:
Dollar General Corporation has been delivering value to shoppers for more than 80 years. Dollar General helps shoppers Save time. Save money. Every day.® by offering products that are frequently used and replenished, such as food, snacks, health and beauty aids, cleaning supplies, basic apparel, housewares and seasonal items at everyday low prices in convenient neighborhood locations. Dollar General operated 17,266 stores in 46 states as of February 26, 2021. Learn more about Dollar General at www.dollargeneral.com.
KNOWLEDGE and SKILLS:
Ability to perform mathematical calculations such as addition, subtraction, multiplication, division, and percentages.
Knowledge of cash handling procedures including cashier accountability and deposit control.
Ability to perform IBM cash register functions.
Knowledge of cash, facility and safety control policies and practices.
Effective interpersonal and oral & written communication skills.
Understanding of safety policies and practices.
Ability to read and follow plan-o-gram and merchandise presentation guidance.
WORK EXPERIENCE and/or EDUCATION:
High school diploma or equivalent and six months of supervisory experience (or related experience/training) preferred.
Relocation assistance is not available for this position.
Dollar General Corporation is an equal opportunity employer.
GENERAL SUMMARY:
Function as a Cashier and/or Stocker and act in a lead capacity in the absence of the Store Manager or Assistant Store Manager. Assist in setting and maintaining plan-o-grams and programs. Provide exemplary customer service. Perform other duties as necessary to maximize profitability, customer satisfaction, and teamwork, while protecting company assets and reducing losses.
DUTIES and ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:
Unload trucks according to the prescribed process for the store.
Follow company work processes to receive, open and unpack cartons and totes.
Stock merchandise; rotate and face merchandise on shelves and build merchandise displays.
Restock returned and recovered merchandise.
Order zones and drop shipment categories, following prescribed ordering practices, as assigned by the Store Manager.
Assist in plan-o-gram implementation and maintenance.
Assist customers by locating merchandise.
Bail cardboard and take out trash; dust and mop store floors; clean restroom and stockroom.
Greet customers as they enter the store.
Maintain register countertops and bags; implement register countertop plan-o-grams.
Operate cash register and flatbed scanner to itemize and total customer's purchase; bag merchandise.
Collect payment from customer and make change.
Clean front end of store and help set up sidewalk displays.
Help to maintain a clean, well-organized store and facilitate a safe and secure working and shopping environment.
Provide superior customer service leadership.
Follow company policies and procedures as outlined in the Standard Operating Procedures manual, Employee Handbook, and company communications.
Open and/or close the store under specific direction of the Area Manager.
In the Absence of the Store Manager or Assistant Store Manager:
Authorize and sign for refunds and overrides; count register; make bank deposits.
Assist in maintaining strict cashier accountability, key control, and adherence to company security practices and cash control procedures.
Monitor cash levels and make appropriate drawer pulls as directed by the Store Manager.
Monitor cameras for unusual activities (customers and employees), if applicable.
Supply cashiers with change when needed.
Complete all required paperwork and documentation according to guidelines and deadlines as assigned.

We are currently hiring for a 9:30 am - 6:00 pm shift with one evening per month and occasional weekends only between October - March.
It’s an exciting time to join Fallon Health as we experience growth and expansion with new services and products. There are many great opportunities within our organization starting with joining our Member Services team. Member Services offers a very unique opportunity to interact with nearly every facet of the Fallon Health organization including our products, services, functions, and people.
Among the most rewarding and fulfilling parts of working on this team is representing Fallon Health as the face of the organization; the single point of contact for our valued providers and members. Think of yourself as an Fallon brand and membership ambassador. As a representative of Fallon Health, you will be an advocate to members reaching out for support; providing this highly valued service fielding calls and constitutively troubleshooting inquiries, you will be solving their needs and concerns.
In addition to the diverse responsibilities outlined below, a spot on this team also represents one of the best places to grow your career. With demonstrated initiative and strong performance, you will gain exposure across a multitude of functions and endless opportunities for advancement. Member Services has proven to be a launching pad of development that has translated into long term careers with advancement opportunities throughout the company in a number of different key area’s such as; Sales and Marketing, Provider Relations, Care Services, Pharmacy and other functions of the operation.
As a brand champion and valued member ambassador you will get extensive training and support through a skill based progression training program that includes a blended learning curriculum and personalized coaching plan. We are always looking for top talent in these roles so feel free to pass this along to friends, family and colleagues that you think qualify.

Responsibilities:

Position Overview:
The Member Services Representative is accountable for successfully addressing member and provider inquiries received through Fallon Health's 1-800 numbers, as well as providing direction on Plan policies, procedures, and benefits.
Some key responsibilities include:
Ownership for development of knowledge and skills, as training program provides material and framework for success.
Ownership for customer satisfaction. Member Service Representatives are the primary liaison for our members to obtain the information or support they need As such, our representatives are expected to fully understand member/ provider needs, and within corporate/ department policies, take whatever action is necessary to fully satisfy the inquiry.
Clear and concise documentation of call detail for tracking of member/ provider contacts.
Identification and communication of trends that are indicative of enterprise service issues.
Escalation of member/provider concerns and servicing issues.
Appropriate execution of corporate and department policies/ practices.
Qualifications:
High school diploma required, Bachelor’s degree or advanced education desirable
2+ years professional work experience preferably in a customer facing inbound call-center setting.
The ability to multitask and leverage strong typing skills and a high proficiency with MS Word, MS Excel and system data entry are essential tools for success in this role
About Fallon Health:
Founded in 1977, Fallon Health is a leading health care services organization that supports the diverse and changing needs of those we serve. In addition to offering innovative health insurance solutions and a variety of Medicaid and Medicare products, we excel in creating unique health care programs and services that provide coordinated, integrated care for seniors and individuals with complex health needs. Fallon has consistently ranked among the nation’s top health plans, and is the only health plan in Massachusetts to have been awarded “Excellent” Accreditation by the National Committee for Quality Assurance for its HMO, Medicare Advantage and Medicaid products. For more information, visit www.fallonhealth.org

REPLENISHES STOCK ON THE SALES FLOOR AS PART OF THE EARLY MORNING STOCKING CREW. PERFORMS A VARIETY OF MANUAL TASKS INVOLVING MODERATELY HEAVY PHYSICAL EFFORT. 1. MOVES MERCHANDISE TO SALES FLOOR USING HAND, ROLLER JACK, PALLET JACK, DOLLY, OR HAND TRUCK. 3. CLEANS FIXTURES AND REMOVES BOXES, TRASH, AND EXCESS MERCHANDISE FROM THE SALES FLOOR. 4. MAY PARTICIPATE IN TAKING INVENTORY AT REQUIRED INTERVALS. 5. PERFORMS OTHER RELATED DUTIES AS ASSIGNED.ACTIVELY COMMUNICATES/PROMOTES THE BENEFITS OF THE MILITARY STAR CREDIT CARD TO CUSTOMERS IN ORDER TO DRIVE SALES GROWTH AND INCREASE CUSTOMER LOYALTY

TINKER MAIN STORE
Job Grade
2
Career Area
Logistics
Supervisor
No
Who We Are
The Army & Air Force Exchange Service, also known as “the Exchange,” is the retailer on US Army and Air Force installations worldwide. An $8 billion enterprise ranked among the top retailers, the Exchange operates department stores, convenience stores, restaurants, movie theaters and an internet shopping site to serve Soldiers, Airmen and their families. In addition to US bases in Germany, Italy, England, Turkey, South Korea and Japan, the Exchange operates stores for US troops in Iraq, Afghanistan and other countries in the region. The Exchange ensures Soldiers and Airmen have access to US goods and services, wherever they serve.
Our Focus
We are seeking associates who have a passion for delivering an extraordinary customer experience and a passion for serving those who serve, our Soldiers, Airmen and their families

MUST BE ABLE TO MOVE AT A FAST PACE AND GET MERCHANDISE TO SALES FLOOR IN A TIMELY MANNER.

job_title: Full Time Personal Assistant San Francisco, CA
summary: Arranging the installation and setup of new home equipment (furniture, home theater upgrades, decor (in collaboration with interior design contractors), patio…
location: San Francisco, CA 94112 (Outer Mission area)+1 location
job_description:
Full Time
San Francisco, California 94112
A couple in San Francisco, CA is seeking a Full-Time Personal Assistant. They are looking for an organized, efficient, pragmatic problem-solver with a can-do attitude.

Clients are both busy executives at a different social-mission-oriented organization, and some of the work may be split across the organizations where they work.

They are both experienced managers and envision a respectful, collaborative relationship with regular check-ins and lots of two-way communication. They hope working with them will be a fulfilling and interesting role and would love to find ways to help advance in your career goals.

The role

Clients will generally ask you to help solve problems that would otherwise require a lot of time from them. For example:

Arranging repairs and ensuring that they go well (including by hiring e.g.TaskRabbits and checking their work).
Arranging the installation and setup of new home equipment (furniture, home theater upgrades, decor (in collaboration with interior design contractors), patio heater, etc.
Organizing and rearranging their home (e.g., switching which rooms are used for what while ensuring that everything stays organized and easy to find).
Researching what products to buy (e.g., for a new oven or dishwasher)
Helping to plan and arrange travel, including researching flights and accommodations
General problem-solving (past examples include figuring out how to cool a difficult-to-cool room, how to get a room to stay dark for sleeping, ordering baby supplies, etc.)
Calling customer service, medical agencies, day cares, etc. to secure appointments, purchases, etc. when this can’t be done online
Occasional routine tasks, including:
Restocking groceries and other supplies in the house
Paying bills
Watering plants

The general goal is to think tasks like these through thoroughly and set things up so that they save as much time as possible.

They have one infant and childcare is NOT required as they have separate employees who cover this.

Qualifications
Strong organizational skills.
Tendency to ask lots of questions; focus on learning and improving over time.
Creative problem-solving abilities for tasks such as the above.
General interest in how to set things up so that they are efficient and convenient.
Track record of successful, reliable operational or assistant work.
Growth mindset and interest in increasing your skills over time.
Open and direct communication.
Punctuality and reliability.
Willingness to respectfully give and receive feedback
Primary residence in the Bay Area (though the role could potentially evolve to be part-time remote or fully remote over time)

Required:

Right to work in the US.
Valid driver’s license.
Willing and able to comply with the family’s COVID-19 safety protocols, such as being willing to take regular rapid tests.
Proof of vaccination is required. (They are also vaccinated and happy to take rapid tests on request.)

Compensation:

$100,000+ per year commensurate with experience.

JOB TITLE: Human Resources Assistant
DEPARTMENT: Human Resources
JOB STATUS: Non-Exempt
SALARY RANGE: $40,000-$48,000/yearly. Salary is based on education and years of experience.
REPORTS TO: Director of HR
DIRECT REPORTS: None
JOB SUMMARY:
North American Services Inc is looking for a HR Assistant who enjoys working with people in a collaborative environment and embodies the core values that we follow, to achieve universal prosperity with our Customers, Company, Team Members and Communities. We are a growing organization that has five major subsidiaries under it: CrossCountry Freight Solutions, Price Truck Line, RAC Transport, DATS and MTS.
Our Human Resource team is focused on a positive culture and driving efficiencies. We are looking for someone who is detailed oriented, able to multi-task, and has great customer service skills! Our goal is to develop a long-term employee who wants to be successful and always willing to learn more!
ESSENTIAL JOB DUTIES:
 Develop and maintain successful relationships with team members and external stakeholders.
 Process paperwork and/or forms in an accurate and timely manner. Ensure personnel and department information is kept organized, up-to-date, and strictly confidential.
 Responsible for the onboarding documentation of employees.
 Responsible for data entry

job_description:
Overview:

Executive Assistant
Direct Hire
Remote + Onsite, San Francisco 94107
Up to $120k/yr + Stock & Benefits
We are all about making medical records easy to access and using data to power the next frontier of medical research. We work directly with patients to give them the only tool anywhere that truly provides all of their medical records from any doctor or healthcare system in the US—in an easy-to-use, secure online dashboard.
As the Executive Assistant, you will be responsible for:
Work with the CEO & CTO (Client Co-Founders) to align their time and energy to their priorities each day, week, month, so that they are best positioned to lead the team through this phase of hyper growth.
This will include supporting the collective schedules of the broader Executive Team, as well as the CEO & CTO’s individual priorities, tasks and schedules
Oversee general office operation, this will include:
Purchasing office supplies & food items; maintaining proper stock levels
Coordinating with the property manager when any building issues arise
Ordering lunch for the office 2x week
In order to successfully carry out this function, you’ll need to:
Set up and manage a basic system for understanding the CEO & CTO’s priorities, scheduling, getting input, and reporting on progress (including the status of any pending tasks);
Manage their calendars in a timely and logical manner:
Timely: responding to scheduling requests within 1 hour of receipt between 8am-7pm.
Logical: making sure the meetings that are on their calendar are actually necessary and aligned to their priorities and are scheduled in a way that makes sense.
Communicate in a timely, professional, friendly manner with internal and external stakeholders, over email, phone, chat.
Figure out how to get the information and feedback you need from them in a way that is as easy as possible for them
Be available to respond to scheduling requests, logistical and other admin requests, during off hours as well (e.g. 8am-9pm)
Proactively identify and solve problems as they arise, and quickly calibrating with them on how/when to bring them in;
Have a great attitude, be flexible, adaptable, and solutions oriented
Ideally you have:
3+ years of experience supporting senior leaders at a high growth organization
Experience working with GSuite, Slack
Please submit your resume for consideration. Thank you!

job_description:
[11:03 AM] Loren Atkins

Data Entry Clerk

Thank you for taking a quick look at this position. Ultimate Staffing is partnered with a wonderful company that is looking for a data entry specialist. If you are interested, please apply!

Hours: Monday-Friday (8:00am-5:00pm)

Compensation: $18.00-$22.00/hour (depending on experience)

Responsibilities

Transfer data from paper formats into computer files or database systems using keyboards, data recorders or optical scanners
Type in data provided directly from customers
Create spreadsheets with large numbers of figures without mistakes
Verify data by comparing it to source documents
Update existing data
Retrieve data from the database or electronic files as requested
Perform regular backups to ensure data preservation
Sort and organize paperwork after entering data to ensure it is not lost
Requirements

High school diploma or equivalent
Proven experience as data entry clerk
Fast typing skills; Knowledge of touch typing system is strongly preferred
Excellent knowledge of word processing tools and spreadsheets (MS Office Word, Excel etc.)
Working knowledge of office equipment and computer hardware and peripheral devices
Basic understanding of databases
Good command of English both oral and written and customer service skills
Great attention to detail

We are an equal opportunity employer and make hiring decisions based on merit. Recruitment, hiring, training, and job assignments are made without regard to race, color, national origin, age, ancestry, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, marital status, disability, or any other protected classification. We consider all qualified applicants, including those with criminal histories, in a manner consistent with state and local laws, including the City of Los Angeles' Fair Chance Initiative for Hiring Ordinance.

summary: Greeting customers and visitors to the office, ensuring guests are comfortable and are connected with the right office personnel.
job_description:
Office Coordinator
Office Coordinator: Energy corridor- Houston, TX
We are recruiting for an office coordinator to join our team who will be in charge of supporting the general office operation by fulfilling a wide range of administrative duties. To be successful as an office coordinator you will need to be comfortable working in a fast-paced environment, making travel arrangements, and running office errands.


RESPONSIBILITIES
Answering phone calls and transferring callers as appropriate
Greeting customers and visitors to the office, ensuring guests are comfortable and are connected with the right office personnel
Managing schedules for conference and community spaces
Monitoring and ordering inventory for office and break room supplies
Managing incoming and outgoing correspondence, including emails, faxes, mail and packages
Filing and organizing records, invoices and other important documentation
Maintains security by following building management procedures; issuing visitor badges.
Ability to multitask in fast changing priorities.
Schedule, coordinate meeting rooms for office personnel.
Order office supplies and business cards as needed.
Keep conference rooms tidy for meetings throughout the day.
Wipe down and sanitize shared spaces daily
Keeping the kitchen tidy and replenishing kitchen supplies daily.
Assist with ordering lunch for meetings.
Making regular runs to the post office
Running errands for the company as required
Domestic travel scheduling.
Submitting work orders and scheduling repairs for general office space and equipment
Ordering repairs for office equipment and maintenance, connecting with and escorting vendors
Assist with ordering lunch for Executive team, or as needed for meetings, daily.
Have a positive attitude.
Serves as back-up to Executive Assistant as needed.
Other general duties as assigned.
Requirements:
Need to be comfortable with a fast-paced environment
Will be scheduling international and domestic travel - will train
Must be OK with getting the owner?s coffee and running office errands
Will support and report to the Office Manager

The primary objective is to enable a positive customer experience by satisfying customer requests with timely and effective communication, executing orders consistently to enable on time deliveries, and performing transactions in the enterprise system with high accuracy. This is a full-time position, Monday-Friday, daytime hours at the Northstar Chemical location in Santa Fe Springs, CA.Our employees are our greatest asset. The Customer Service Representative must be reliable, respectful, empathetic and detail oriented. We want individuals interested in taking on responsibility, learning, being part of a team and respecting organizational policies and procedures. We are willing to train the right candidate.We are eager to attract the best, so we offer competitive compensation and a generous benefits package, including paid vacation, health insurance (medical and dental), 401(k), life insurance, disability and more.ESSENTIAL DUTIES/RESPONSIBILITIES: Responsibilities include, but are not limited to the following:Monitor communication received by phone or e-mail from the customer during normal business hours (currently 8:30 am to 5 pm). Print and arrange shipping documents.Set up and maintain customer accounts in the computer system.Cover (as a backup to the primary person) for logistics arrangements to enable product delivery including arranged freight with contract carriers and dispatch routing of company drivers.Understand and abide by all Northstar Chemical policies and procedures. Ability to resolve conflicts in a professional manner. Ability to prioritize in a dynamic environment.High School Diploma / GED.Preferred qualifications but not required:Associate or Bachelor’s Degree.Work experience in distribution of products, preferably from multiple vendors and warehouses.Experience in supply chain work processes such as supply planning, inventory control, product cost management, production model (batch formulations).Logistics experience including assignment of orders for transport to contract carriers and managing carrier delivery performance, paperwork and freight invoice reconciliation.Working Conditions: The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Extensive computer and telephone use.
